In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is one way to implement the `add_yearmonth` function in Julia:
```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    # Create a new column ym with the year-month information from dt
    df[!,:ym] = map(x -> Dates.value(Dates.Date(x.year, x.month, 1)), df[:dt])
end
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a transformation to each element in the `dt` column of the DataFrame. The transformation extracts the year and month information from the DateTime object using the `year` and `month` functions from the `Dates` module, creates a new Date object with just the year and month information, and then converts it to an integer using the `value` function.
The resulting integers in the new `ym` column will be in the format "yyyymm".
